verses.text: 肢體的聯繫因此，我這為主被囚禁的勸你們：行事為人，要配得上你們所蒙的呼召，

words.note: Refers to body parts, metaphorically used for church members.
Lit. 'acting and being human'; refers to one's conduct.
The suffix '上' here indicates reaching a standard.
Often used in religious contexts to mean 'receive grace/blessing'.

verses.text: 凡事謙虛、溫柔、忍耐，用愛心彼此寬容；
以和睦聯繫，竭力持守聖靈所賜的合一。
身體只有一個，聖靈只有一位，就像你們蒙召只是藉著一個盼望。

words.note: A respectful measure word for people.

verses.text: 主只有一位，信仰只有一個，洗禮只有一種；

words.note: A respectful measure word for people.

verses.text: 神只有一位，就是萬有的父。他超越萬有，貫徹萬有，並且在萬有之中。

words.note: Often used to emphasize a statement or introduce a consequence.
Refers to everything that exists.
Used here in a theological sense for God.
Implies thoroughgoing influence or presence.
A more formal way to say 'in' or 'among'.

verses.text: 我們各人蒙恩，是照著基督量給我們的恩賜。

words.note: Implies a precise or intentional distribution.
Refers to a spiritual gift.

verses.text: 所以他說：「他升上高天的時候，擄了許多俘虜，把賞賜給了人。」

words.note: Used here to form a temporal clause '...的時候' (when...)
Used to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: （「他升上」這句話是甚麼意思呢？他不是也曾降到地上嗎？
那降下的，就是那升到諸天之上的，為了要使他充滿萬有。）

words.note: Acts as a demonstrative pronoun, nominalizing the following verb phrase.
Nominalizes the preceding verb phrase '那降下的' (the one who descended).
Acts as a demonstrative pronoun, nominalizing the following verb phrase.
Often refers to the multiple levels of heaven in biblical cosmology.
A more formal way to say 'above'.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '那升到諸天之上的' (the one who ascended above all heavens).

verses.text: 他所賜的，有作使徒的，有作先知的，有作傳福音的，也有作牧養和教導的，

words.note: Often combined with a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Formal or respectful term for giving.
Lit. 'sent disciple'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Lit. 'to transmit blessed news'.
Implies caring and guiding a flock.

verses.text: 為的是要裝備聖徒，去承擔聖工，建立基督的身體；

words.note: 為的是 means 'for the purpose of'.

words.definition: to be going to, ought to

words.note: Here implies 'for the purpose of going to do X'.
In biblical context, refers to the church as Christ's body.

verses.text: 直到我們眾人對 神的兒子都有一致的信仰和認識，可以長大成人，達到基督豐盛長成的身量；

words.note: Refers to the singular, true God in Christianity.
In biblical context, refers to Jesus, the Son of God.
Common idiom, here used spiritually.
Refers to reaching full development or maturity.
Often refers to physical height, but here, spiritual maturity.

verses.text: 使我們不再作小孩子，中了人的詭計和騙人的手段，給異教之風搖撼，飄來飄去，

words.note: Figurative for spiritual immaturity.

words.definition: to fall into, to be hit by

words.note: Lit. 'wind of strange teachings'.

words.definition: to be tossed to and fro
words.note: Describes unstable, wavering movement.

verses.text: 卻要在愛中過誠實的生活，在各方面長進，達到基督的身量。他是教會的頭，

words.note: Refers to agape love in a Christian context.
Refers to spiritual maturity.
Figurative for leader or authority.

verses.text: 全身靠著他，藉著每一個關節的支持，照著每部分的功用，配合聯繫起來，使身體漸漸長大，在愛中建立自己。
要穿上新人所以，我要這樣說，並且要在主裡肯定地說：你們行事為人不要再像教外人，存著虛妄的意念。

words.note: Refers to a spiritually renewed person in Christ.
A common title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
Literally 'act, do things, be a person'.
Refers to those outside the Christian faith.
Often refers to worldly or godless vanity.

verses.text: 他們的心思昏昧，因為自己無知，心裡剛硬，就與 神所賜的生命隔絕了。

words.note: Often used to describe spiritual darkness or ignorance.
Frequently used in the Bible to describe a hardened heart or resistance to God.
The preceding space is a common honorific formatting in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 他們既然麻木不仁，就任憑自己放縱情慾，貪行各樣污穢的事。

words.note: Literally 'numb and not benevolent'.
Often refers to sinful or worldly desires.
Refers to acting out of excessive desire or greed.
Often refers to moral or spiritual impurity.

verses.text: 但是你們從基督所學的，卻不是這樣。
如果你們聽了他，在他裡面受過教導，（因為真理是在耶穌裡的，）

words.note: Indicates a past action/experience.

verses.text: 就要除去你們那照著從前生活方式而活的舊人。這舊人是隨著迷惑人的私慾漸漸敗壞的。

words.note: Connects clauses, often showing progression or result.
Refers to the sinful nature or former way of life before conversion.
Functions as a possessive modifier here.
Refers to sinful, worldly desires.
Reduplication emphasizes the gradual nature.
Describes moral decay or spiritual corruption.

verses.text: 你們要把心靈更換一新，

words.note: Introduces object of a verb, indicating its disposal/manipulation.
Often used in religious contexts for the inner being.
Often follows verbs like '更新' (renew) or '更換'.

verses.text: 並且穿上新人。這新人是照著 神的形象，在公義和真實的聖潔裡創造的。

words.note: Refers to the new nature or identity in Christ.
Empty character, often used to signify reverence for 'God'.
Usually capitalized in Christian texts to refer to the Creator.
Refers to being created 'in the image of God'.
A core theological concept.
A state of being set apart for God.

verses.text: 新人的表現所以，你們要除掉謊言，各人要與鄰舍說真話，因為我們彼此是肢體。

words.note: This phrase serves as a heading for the following section.
Often used in a moral/ethical context in scripture.
Metaphor for believers as parts of Christ's body.

verses.text: 生氣卻不要犯罪；含怒不可到日落。

words.note: Lit. 'produce anger/air'.
不要 (bùyào) means 'do not'.
Often used in a biblical context for suppressed anger.
不可 (bùkě) means 'must not'.

verses.text: 不可給魔鬼留地步。

words.note: 不可 (bùkě) means 'must not'.
Figuratively, 'foothold' or 'opportunity'.

verses.text: 偷竊的，不要再偷，卻要作工，親手作正當的事，使自己可以把所得到的，分給缺乏的人。

words.note: Turns the preceding verb into a noun, 'the one who steals'.
不要 (bùyào) means 'do not'.
Introduces object before verb.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb.

verses.text: 一句壞話也不可出口，卻要適當地說造就人的好話，使聽見的人得益處。

words.note: 不可 (bùkě) means 'must not'.
Forms an adverb from adjective.
Common in Christian contexts for spiritual building up.

verses.text: 不可讓 神的聖靈憂傷，因為你們受了他的印記，等候得贖的日子。

words.note: 不可 (bùkě) means 'must not'.
Reverence mark for God.
Indicates completed action.
Refers to the Holy Spirit.
Often used for spiritual 'seal' in NT.

verses.text: 一切苛刻、惱怒、暴戾、嚷鬧、毀謗，連同一切惡毒，都應當從你們中間除掉。

words.note: Refers to a cruel or demanding attitude.
A strong feeling of displeasure.
Implies a fierce, cruel nature.
Loud, confused noise; often associated with contention.
False statements damaging reputation.
Malicious intent or evil behavior.

verses.text: 要互相友愛，存溫柔的心，彼此饒恕，就像 神在基督裡饒恕了你們一樣。

words.note: Used as a modal verb indicating obligation or strong recommendation.
Implies love and affection among brethren.
In a biblical context, often refers to meekness or humility.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates completion of an action.
